en.purpose: To stratify patients to Risk classes (I-V) and predict in-hospital survival after VA ECMO for refractory cardiogenic shock based on the calculated SAVE score.
en.use:
To calculate SAVE score.

Formula:
Addition of selected points minus 6.

Variable                                                                                                                                                                Points

Age, years                             18-38                                                                                                                         7
                                               39-52                                                                                                                        4
                                               53-62                                                                                                                        3
                                               >= 63                                                                                                                        0
Weight                         65-89 kg (143.3-196.2 lbs)                                                                                                  2
                                       <65 kg (<143.3 lbs)                                                                                                          1
                                       >89 kg (>196.2 lbs)                                                                                                          0

Etiology of cardiogenic shock*
Myocarditis                                                                                                                                                              3
Refractory VT/VF                                                                                                                                                     2
Post heart or lung transplantation                                                                                                                            3
Congenital heart disease                                                                                                                                         -3

Renal
Acute renal failure (defined as acute renal insufficiency (e.g. creatinine >1.5 mg/dL (132.6 µmol/L) with or without RRT)    -3
Chronic renal failure (defined as either kidney damage or GFR <60 mL/min/1.73 m² for ≥3 months)                                    -6
HCO₃ before ECMO ≤15 mmol/L (91.5 mg/dL) (worst value within 6 hrs before ECMO cannulation)                                    -3

Respiratory
Duration of intubation prior to initiation of ECMO, hrs                    ≤10                                                                                    0
                                                                                                       11-29                                                                                 -2
                                                                                                        ≥30                                                                                   -4
Peak inspiratory pressure ≤20 cm H₂O (≤2.0 kPa)                                                                                                                    3

Cardiac
Pre-ECMO cardiac arrest                                                                                                                                                          -2
Diastolic blood pressure before ECMO ≥40 mmHg (worst value within 6 hrs before ECMO cannulation)                                3
Pulse pressure before ECMO ≤20 mmHg (worst value within 6 hrs before ECMO cannulation)                                              -2

Other organ failures pre-ECMO
Liver failure (defined as bilirubin ≥33 µmol/L (1.9 mg/dL) or elevation of serum aminotransferases (ALT or AST) >70 UI/L)           -3
CNS dysfunction (includes combined neurotrauma, stroke, encephalopathy, cerebral embolism, seizure/epileptic syndromes)     -3

*If any other cause of cardiogenic shock, no points are added.

Interpretations: 

SAVE Score        Risk class        In-hospital survival  	
      
    >5                          I                         75%
  1 to 5                      II                         58%
  -4 to 0                    III                         42%
  -9 to -5                   IV                         30%
    ≤-10                      V                         18%
en.misuse: Do not use in patients receiving veno-venous (VV) ECMO

other_details.references:
1. Schmidt M, Burrell A, Roberts L, Bailey M, Sheldrake J, Rycus PT, et al. Predicting survival after ECMO for refractory cardiogenic shock: the survival after veno-arterial-ECMO (SAVE)-score. Eur Heart J. 2015 Sep 1;36(33):2246–56.
2. Chen W-C, Huang K-Y, Yao C-W, Wu C-F, Liang S-J, Li C-H, et al. The modified SAVE score: predicting survival using urgent veno-arterial extracorporeal membrane oxygenation within 24 hours of arrival at the emergency department. Crit Care. 2016 Oct 22;20(1):336.

when: $gt0014|Duration of intubation prior to initiation of ECMO, hrs|!=null

gt0003.description: Age in years, and for babies: months, weeks or days

gt0011.description: Defined as acute renal insufficiency (e.g. creatinine >1.5 mg/dL (132.6 µmol/L) with or without RRT

gt0012.description: Defined as either kidney damage or GFR <60 mL/min/1.73 m² for ≥3 months

gt0013.text: HCO₃ before ECMO ≤15 mmol/L (91.5 mg/dL) (worst value within 6 hrs before ECMO cannulation)

gt0014.text: Duration of intubation prior to initiation of ECMO, hrs

gt0015.text: Peak inspiratory pressure ≤20 cm H₂O (≤2.0 kPa)

gt0017.text: Diastolic blood pressure before ECMO ≥40 mmHg (worst value within 6 hrs before ECMO cannulation)
gt0017.description: Worst value within 6 hrs before ECMO cannulation

gt0018.text: Pulse pressure before ECMO ≤20 mmHg (worst value within 6 hrs before ECMO cannulation)
gt0018.description: Worst value within 6 hrs before ECMO cannulation

gt0019.description: Defined as bilirubin ≥33 µmol/L (1.9 mg/dL) or elevation of serum aminotransferases (ALT or AST) >70 UI/L

gt0020.description: Includes combined neurotrauma, stroke, encephalopathy, cerebral embolism, seizure/epileptic syndromes
